intro: Psychotria barbata, commonly known as the velvetleaf psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats. Psychotria barbata is also known for its use in traditional medicine and its potential psychoactive properties.
